title: City Council Approves New Green Spaces Initiative
summary: Plan adds micro‑parks and rooftop gardens across downtown.
content: The City Council unanimously approved a multi‑year initiative to add micro‑parks, rooftop gardens, and street trees aimed at reducing heat islands and improving air quality.

title: Tech Firm Announces Affordable Home Battery System
summary: New unit targets apartments with modular design.
content: VoltNest unveiled a modular, apartment‑friendly home battery targeting renters, with installation that avoids permanent fixtures and promises peak‑shaving savings.

title: Study Claims Coffee Boosts Memory by 30% Overnight
summary: Researchers publish small cohort results; experts urge caution.
content: A small observational study suggested a correlation between evening coffee consumption and next‑day memory performance. Independent experts cautioned against over‑interpreting the findings due to confounders.

title: Regional Rail Adds Late‑Night Service On Weekends
summary: Transit authority expands coverage for nightlife and shift workers.
content: The transit authority announced additional late‑night trains on Fridays and Saturdays to improve access for nightlife patrons and overnight shift workers across the region.

title: Local Startup Uses AI To Reduce Food Waste in Cafeterias
summary: Computer vision forecasts portions and prevents over‑prepping.
content: PlateSight launched a computer‑vision system that forecasts serving volumes by time block, helping cafeterias adjust prep levels and reduce daily food waste by up to 18% in pilots.

title: Ocean Cleanup Drone Allegedly Finds Gold Bars Near Pier
summary: Viral post shows blurry footage; authorities find no evidence.
content: A viral clip purportedly showing an ocean cleanup drone recovering gold bars near the old pier has been debunked by local authorities, who reported no such recovery in official logs.

title: University Opens Free Night Classes For Community
summary: Program focuses on digital literacy and resume workshops.
content: The university is opening free evening classes to the public covering digital literacy, resume building, and interview prep, funded by a workforce development grant.

title: New App Promises To Read Dreams Through Micro‑Movements
summary: Developers claim 85% accuracy without peer review.
content: An app claiming to decode dreams using micro‑movement signals collected via a smartphone accelerometer has drawn skepticism from sleep researchers due to a lack of published validation.

title: Farmers Market Extends Season With Heated Tents
summary: Vendors to continue through early spring weekends.
content: The downtown farmers market will extend through early spring using heated tents and staggered vendor schedules to maintain turnout during colder weeks.

title: Private Space Company Tests Reusable Upper Stage
summary: Engine relight and controlled splashdown demonstrated.
content: Astral Dynamics completed a test of a reusable upper stage featuring engine relight and controlled splashdown, a step toward fully reusable orbital vehicles.

title: Viral Hack Says Free Internet With Foil On Router Antennas
summary: Experts warn it's misleading and may degrade signal.
content: A trending video suggests wrapping router antennas in foil grants free internet. Networking experts called it misinformation that can interfere with signal patterns and performance.

title: City Library Adds Makerspace With 3D Printers
summary: Community access to prototyping tools expands.
content: The central library unveiled a makerspace with 3D printers, laser cutters, and soldering stations to support community projects and STEM education.

title: Influencer Claims Salt Water Cures Seasonal Flu
summary: Medical professionals refute unproven remedy.
content: A social media post claiming that drinking salt water cures seasonal flu has been debunked by physicians as potentially dangerous and unsupported by evidence.

title: Neighborhood Pilot Replaces Some Parking With Bike Corrals
summary: Early data shows increased retail foot traffic.
content: A neighborhood pilot replacing select parking spots with bike corrals and delivery zones reported a modest uptick in foot traffic and shorter double‑parking durations.

title: Startup Says It Can 10x Plant Growth With Ultrasound
summary: Press release lacks peer‑reviewed backing.
content: GrowWave claims ultrasound stimulation accelerates plant growth tenfold. Botanists urged careful validation, noting prior studies show only limited effects in controlled settings.

title: Regional Hospital Opens New Emergency Wing
summary: Additional beds and imaging capacity reduce wait times.
content: A new emergency wing opened today with expanded triage, additional beds, and on‑site imaging to reduce patient wait times during peak hours.

title: Video Claims Moon Is A Hologram Projected By Satellites
summary: Astronomers dismiss recycled conspiracy theory.
content: A resurfaced conspiracy theory alleging the Moon is a hologram has circulated again. Astronomers reiterated abundant physical evidence disproving the claim.

title: County Launches Free Tree Giveaway For Residents
summary: Homeowners can request up to two native saplings.
content: The county's sustainability office launched a free tree program offering up to two native saplings per household while supplies last.

title: Miracle Mineral Solution Resurfaces As Anti‑Virus Cure
summary: Health agencies reiterate warnings against ingestion.
content: Posts promoting so‑called Miracle Mineral Solution as an antiviral cure have reappeared. Health agencies emphasized it is dangerous and not an approved treatment.

title: High‑Speed Fiber Expansion Reaches 20,000 More Homes
summary: Phase 2 buildout focuses on underserved blocks.
content: Netline announced phase 2 of its fiber rollout, connecting an additional 20,000 homes with an emphasis on previously underserved neighborhoods.

title: Post Claims Lemon Juice Prevents All Colds
summary: Doctors: nutrition helps, but no single cure‑all.
content: A trending post asserts lemon juice prevents all colds. Physicians note a balanced diet supports immunity, but no food guarantees prevention.

title: New Coastal Trail Segment Opens To Cyclists
summary: Scenic route adds safer separation from traffic.
content: A newly opened coastal trail segment adds separated cycling lanes and improved signage, connecting two popular waterfront parks.

title: Startup Claims Headphones Can Teach A Language Overnight
summary: Bold claims lack independent validation.
content: LinguaNap markets headphones that allegedly teach languages during sleep. Linguists say evidence for sleep‑learning remains limited and mixed.

title: Urban School Adds Free Breakfast For All Students
summary: Program aims to improve attendance and focus.
content: An urban district expanded free breakfast to all students after a pilot showed improved attendance and classroom engagement.

title: Photos Claim River Ran Backwards After Minor Quake
summary: Geologists: images are edited; flow unchanged.
content: Edited photos claiming a river reversed flow after a minor quake have circulated. Geologists confirmed no such reversal occurred.

title: Community Garden Network Expands To 12 New Lots
summary: Vacant parcels converted into food‑growing spaces.
content: A nonprofit secured 12 vacant lots for community gardens, partnering with local residents to increase access to fresh produce.

title: Hoax Map Shows Sharks In City Fountain After Storm
summary: Composite image traced to old meme template.
content: A viral image of sharks in a city fountain after a storm has been debunked as a composite from an old meme template.

title: Transit App Adds Real‑Time Crowding Indicators
summary: Data helps riders choose less crowded vehicles.
content: The city's transit app now shows real‑time crowding estimates based on door sensor counts and historical patterns.

title: Claim Says Blue Light Glasses Double Exam Scores
summary: No clinical evidence supports such a jump.
content: A claim that blue light blocking glasses double exam scores lacks credible supporting studies, according to education researchers.

title: Harbor To Host Floating Art Exhibit This Spring
summary: Local artists to display installations on barges.
content: The harbor authority approved a floating art exhibit featuring installations on moored barges, with free weekend viewings.

title: Post Claims Plants Grow Faster Under Constant Music
summary: Effect sizes exaggerated in viral clips.
content: Viral clips exaggerate claims that constant music dramatically boosts plant growth. Horticultural studies show mixed, small effects at best.

title: City Adds Curb‑Level Protected Crosswalks
summary: Raised tables slow cars; early safety gains noted.
content: New curb‑level crosswalks with raised tables and daylighting have reduced near‑miss incidents at pilot intersections, according to traffic engineers.

title: Supposed Ancient Map Proves Lost Continent Nearby
summary: Historians call the artifact a modern forgery.
content: A widely shared image of an 'ancient map' allegedly proving a nearby lost continent has been identified by historians as a 20th‑century forgery.

title: Public Health Dept. Rolls Out Free Vaccination Vans
summary: Mobile clinics to serve outreach events weekly.
content: Mobile vaccination vans will serve weekly outreach events in parks and community centers to expand access to routine immunizations.

title: Claim: Chewing Ice Aligns Teeth Without Braces
summary: Dentists warn it's false and may damage enamel.
content: A circulating claim that chewing ice aligns teeth is false. Dentists warn it can chip teeth and damage enamel.

title: Regional Grid Integrates More Community Solar
summary: Subscribers can offset bills without rooftop panels.
content: The regional grid operator approved additional community solar projects, enabling subscribers to offset portions of their electricity bills.

title: Hoax Says City Banned All Bicycles Downtown
summary: No blanket ban exists; only event‑specific closures.
content: A rumor that all bicycles are banned downtown is false. Officials clarified only temporary closures apply during specific events.

title: Museum Extends Hours For Blockbuster Exhibit
summary: Late evenings on Fridays/Saturdays for next month.
content: The city museum will extend evening hours on weekends to accommodate high interest in its latest exhibit.

title: Post Claims Magnets Pull Toxins Out Of Blood
summary: Medical claim is baseless pseudoscience.
content: A post alleging that household magnets can 'pull toxins' out of blood is baseless and medically inaccurate, experts say.

title: Port Authority Pilots Shore Power For Cargo Ships
summary: Program aims to cut diesel emissions at berth.
content: Cargo ships at two terminals will test shore power hookups to reduce diesel emissions while docked, part of a broader clean air initiative.

title: Viral Tip Says Onions Absorb Viruses In Rooms
summary: Food safety officials call claim false.
content: A viral tip that cut onions absorb viruses in rooms has been debunked; food safety officials warn against leaving cut onions unrefrigerated.

title: Regional Park Adds Night Sky Viewing Events
summary: Volunteer astronomers host monthly star parties.
content: The regional park district announced monthly night sky events with volunteer astronomers and telescope stations.

title: Video Claims Airplane Contrails Are Metal Sprays
summary: Atmospheric scientists refute conspiracy claim.
content: A viral video mischaracterizes airplane contrails as 'metal sprays'. Atmospheric scientists explain contrails are ice crystals from engine exhaust moisture.

title: Main Street To Add Pedestrian‑Only Sundays
summary: Streets open for walking, dining, and performances.
content: City council approved pedestrian‑only Sundays on Main Street, allowing outdoor dining and performances during designated hours.

title: Miracle Bracelet Allegedly Shields From 5G
summary: Product claims lack scientific basis, experts say.
content: A '5G shield' bracelet trending online offers no proven protection against radio signals and may be a scam, according to engineers and consumer advocates.

title: Library Partners With Schools On Homework Help Line
summary: Evening chat connects students with librarians.
content: A new partnership launches an evening homework help chat staffed by librarians and trained volunteers.

title: Post Says Solar Panels Stop Working In Winter
summary: Panels still generate power with proper daylight.
content: A post claiming solar panels 'shut off' in winter is misleading. Panels generate power with daylight, albeit at reduced output under certain conditions.

title: City Launches Tool To Track Pothole Repairs
summary: Open data map shows requests and completion status.
content: An open data dashboard now tracks pothole repair requests, assignments, and completion timelines across neighborhoods.

title: Hoax: Boiling Water Turns Into Fuel With Sugar
summary: Chemists say video is staged; impossible as shown.
content: A hoax video claims boiling water plus sugar becomes 'fuel'. Chemists say the demonstration is staged and violates conservation of energy.

title: Harbor Ferry Adds Bike Racks And Weekend Service
summary: Commuters gain flexible multimodal options.
content: The harbor ferry operator added bike racks and expanded weekend service to accommodate growing demand for multimodal commutes.
